documents.document: @simonrug @ImKateMc Yes. Again correct me if I'm wrong @ImKateMc .
@ImKateMc @rugbyPhilBB @simonrug Is it?! I assumed that was gone. Yikes.

@rugbyPhilBB @simonrug @ImKateMc Hahaha
"Religious persuasion" then!
@rugbyPhilBB @simonrug @ImKateMc Religious thinking is certainly a factor yes.
@rugbyPhilBB @ImKateMc @simonrug *precedence
@rugbyPhilBB @ImKateMc @simonrug The key to victory imo is high turnout from young voters. I'm confident this can happen as there was presence from the SSM referendum in 2015.
@rugbyPhilBB @simonrug @ImKateMc Fixed the link: https://t.co/HJe9HIWvdo

@rugbyPhilBB @simonrug @ImKateMc The answer is it was inserted via referendum in 1983.
Eighth_Amendment_of_the_Constitution_of_Ireland

@ImKateMc @simonrug @LdnIrishARC As Kate says @simonrug, this is an enormous vote. It will say a lot about how the electorate is changing.
Context: In 1983 the 8th amendment referendum (banning abortion) was carried 67% to 33%.

@rugbyPhilBB @simonrug @ImKateMc It's the way the constitution works.
If anything I think a public vote gives a lot more validity too it. It's a clear statement from the electorate.

@simonrug @ImKateMc Who makes the rules though? I agree with you but how do you have a fair system.
Tinfoil hat on here, but you don't want to give the state too big a hand in controlling speech.
@simonrug @ImKateMc It's gotten a lot of attention in NI as abortion is still banned there. If Yes passes, NI people could in theory access abortion in ROI.
@simonrug @ImKateMc Fair enough. However either you scrap public funding of parties (no issue there) or you retain. Otherwise you're discriminating. Dangerous territory.
@simonrug @ImKateMc You get into very murky territory policing what political parties say I suspect, even with ridiculous content such as this.

@simonrug @ImKateMc Correct me if I'm wrong @ImKateMc but the undecideds are still significant. Polling companies suggest undecideds generally vote to retain the status quo. Therefore it's going to be close.
@ImKateMc @simonrug They are getting money from elsewhere I imagine....USD I suspect.
@simonrug @ImKateMc With no seats. They're irrelevant.

@simonrug @ImKateMc Political parties receive funding.

@ImKateMc Their twitter account is an embarrassment. Fundamentalist nonsense.

@motlinebling Sure, I'm just interested in reading arguments and learning.
Personally I think you risk disincentivising work if you over-tax. Though I do need to learn more about how Scandinavian countries make it work.
@motlinebling Sure but you would be in a battle with stakeholders to ensure efficiency. Do you trust politicians to do this when it's not their money they are playing with?
@motlinebling Tough job that. You'd need a very strong government.
@motlinebling FWIW any proposal to restrict free travel scheme to off peak isn't the way.

@motlinebling Do you want people to pay more tax than they are currently doing?
How many people in Ireland cannot afford their necessary public transport? Is it so bad that we need to make it free for everyone, which includes people who can afford it?
@motlinebling No but let's flesh this out.
@bencoles_ RWC 2019
@motlinebling I'd rather pay ad-hoc for my transport to be honest. Free transport scheme is grand as is and due to politics is sealed shut from removal.
@motlinebling Intrigued by this idea of free transport for all. How would it be funded?
